p: Flavor is a major factor that determines consumer selection, perception, acceptance of a particular food product and thus plays a significant role in the food. The flavor of any food is thus largely dependent on the number, quantity, and characteristics of the different volatile compounds it contains (Jelen, Majcher, & Dziadas, 2012). Such is extended to food substances and subsequent preparations from them. Despite the rich flavor and other volatile components present in nkui, previous studies that investigated nkui for these compounds have not been presented in the literature.
